capability_questions.question: Accounts Receivable Management Manage Provider Recoupment Is the process primarily manual or automatic? What is the mode of communication? situations requested? How integrated is the process? use standards in the process? process?

levels.level_1: activity to accomplish tasks. SMA sends communications to providers and other payers via telephone, facsimile, and mail. SMA accomplishes the recouping of monies in third party liability situations from payer-to- provider rather than payer-to-payer. There is little coordination between the portions of SMA responsible for recoupments: third party liability, program integrity, and accounting. SMA focuses on meeting compliance thresholds for state and federal regulations using state- specific standards. Very little collaboration occurs with other agencies to standardize information exchange or business tasks.
levels.level_2: processes to accomplish tasks. Communication to providers and other payers is via telephone, facsimile, and mail; plus, the use of e-mail is increasing and some agencies are sending Accredited Standards Committee (ASC) X12 837 Health Care Claim transactions directly to other payers rather than from payer to provider to request Manage Provider Recoupment payment. SMA still conducts recouping of monies from payer-to-provider but some payer-to- payer interchanges are taking place. There is regular communication and coordination between program integrity, third party liability, recoupments, accounting, and the Medicaid Fraud Control Unit (MFCU). A mix of HIPAA including ASC X12 837 Health Care Claim transactions and state- specific standards are Manage Provider Recoupment applied. SMA collaborates with other agencies and entities to adopt HIPAA standards and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) transactions.
levels.level_3: extent possible within the intrastate. SMA uses primarily electronic communications, using paper only as needed to reach individual providers. Payer-to-payer recoupment processing is the norm with payer-to- provider interchanges the exception. SMA integrates overlapping activities between program integrity, recoupments, third party liability, accounting, and the MFCU, and communication is immediate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for intrastate exchange of information. SMA collaborates with other intrastate agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable business services.
levels.level_4: extent possible across the interstate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and national standards across the interstate. SMA conducts payer-to-payer recoupment processing. SMA fully integrates the process to the extent possible across the interstate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for clinical and interstate information exchange. SMA collaborates with other interstate agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable processes including clinical information.
levels.level_5: extent possible across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and national standards across the nation. SMA conducts payer-to-payer recoupment processing. SMA fully integrates the process to the extent possible across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for national exchange of information. SMA collaborates with agencies and entities for national (and international) interoperability improvements that maximize automation of routine operations.
